us-bibliographic-data-application.invention-title: A Multifunctional Modular Furniture Unit and System

abstract.p: A multifunctional modular furniture unit and system is developed to build a various type of furniture and housing and office accessories that are used in interior design. The multifunctional modular furniture system comprises a plurality of modular units and a plurality of support units. The modular units comprise a top block unit, a link block unit, and a bottom block unit. The support units comprise a support strap and a connection cap. The various furniture can be built utilizing attaching the modular units to each other and using the support units to reinforce a furniture structure.

description.heading: TECHNICAL FIELD
description.p: The present disclosure is related to an interior design system, and in particular related to a modular furniture system, and a modular furniture unit for building various type of furniture and housing and office accessories.
description.heading: BACKGROUND ART
description.p: A wide variety of types and kinds of furniture and methods for assembling furniture exist in the furniture industry. common furniture, such as sofas, chairs, etc., is manufactured and assembled in a factory and shipped as complete units to be distributed and sold at retail and warehouse outlets. However, the complete furniture units, such as sofas, desks, etc. are bulky, difficult to move and maneuver, and costly to replace if they become aged or damaged. Also, in such designs, it is not possible to change and reconfigure the furniture structure.

The ready-to-assembly or the modular furniture attempts to solve many of the problems associated with the complete unit furniture as described above. The modular furniture typically is readily assembled and disassembled. The owner moves modular furniture by taking it apart and moving the parts to a new location. This advantage is particularly important in small spaces, such as small room or apartments which have close quarters.
Thus, based on the above-mentioned issues, an easy to use and multifunctional modular unit has been introduced to build a various type of furniture that can be used in interior design systems.
description.heading: SUMMARY OF INVENTION
description.p: This summary is intended to provide an overview of the subject matter of this disclosure, and is not intended to identify essential elements or key elements of the subject matter, nor is it intended to be used to determine the scope of the claimed implementations. The proper scope of this disclosure may be ascertained from the claims set forth below in view of the detailed description below and the drawings.

In one general aspect, the present disclosure is directed to an exemplary modular furniture unit. The exemplary modular furniture unit may comprise a top block that may configure to build a furniture top outer surface such that the top block may comprise a top face of the top block, at least four side faces of the top block, and a bottom face of the top block. In addition, the top face of the top block may include a flat surface and the side faces of the top block may extend orthogonally away from the top face of the top block to a bottom end of the top block and the bottom face of the top block may include at least one fastening groove. furthermore, the exemplary modular furniture unit may further comprise a bottom block that may configure to build a furniture bottom surface on a ground such that the bottom block may comprise a top face of the bottom block, at least four side faces of the bottom block, and a bottom face of the bottom block. Moreover, the top face of the bottom block may include at least one fastening protrusion and the side faces of the bottom block may extend orthogonally away from the top face of the bottom block to a bottom end of the bottom block. Additionally, the exemplary modular furniture unit may further comprise a link block that may configure to build a furniture main body such that the link block may comprise a top face of the link block, at least four side faces of the link block, and a bottom face of the link block. Furthermore, the top face of the link block may include at least one fastening protrusion and the side faces of the link block may extend orthogonally away from the top face of the link block to a bottom end of the link block and the bottom face of the link block may comprise at least one fastening groove. Moreover, the bottom face of the top block may configure to connect the top block to the top face of the link block or the top face of the bottom block. In addition, the top face of the link block may configure to connect the link block to the bottom face of the top block or a bottom face of another link block and the bottom face of the link block may configure to connect the link block to the top face of the bottom block or a top face of another link block. Furthermore, the top face of the bottom block may configure to connect the bottom block to the bottom face of the link block or the bottom face of the top block.

The above general aspect may have one or more of the following features. In an exemplary implementation, the modular furniture unit may be made of a polystyrene material. In an exemplary implementation, the bottom face of the link block and the bottom face of the top block may further comprise at least one string groove such that the string groove may configure to facilitate a furniture structure reconfigure and a passage of a transverse string. In an exemplary implementation, the transverse string may configure to connect a furniture cover to a furniture body. In an exemplary implementation, the string groove may be embedded transversely and longitudinally within the bottom face of the link block and the bottom face of the top block. In an exemplary implementation, the bottom face of the bottom block may comprise at least one connection cap aperture. In an exemplary implementation, the top face of the link block may comprise at least one connection cap aperture such that the connection cap aperture may embedded within a fastening protrusion tip. In an exemplary implementation, the fastening protrusion and the fastening groove may comprise a Lego-type fastening protrusion and a Lego-type fastening groove. In an exemplary implementation, the fastening protrusion and fastening groove may comprise a polygonal cross section geometry and an inner hollow space. In an exemplary implementation, the polygonal cross section geometry may comprise an octagonal cross-section. In an exemplary implementation, the fastening groove may be designed with a recess in the bottom face of the top block and the bottom face of the link block. In an exemplary implementation, the recess may have an octagonal cylindrical shape. In an exemplary implementation, the octagonal cylindrical shape may comprise a first section and a second section with a different inner diameter such that an inner diameter of the first section may be larger than an inner diameter of the second section such that the fastening protrusion may enter the fastening groove from the second section. In an exemplary implementation, the inner hollow space may configure to pass a support strap. In an exemplary implementation, a connection cap may configure to fasten the support strap and the connection cap may be mounted on the connection cap aperture.

In another general aspect, the present disclosure is directed to exemplary multifunctional modular furniture system to produce various type of a furniture. The exemplary system may comprise a plurality of modular units that may configure to build a furniture structure such that the modular units may include a top block unit, a link block unit, and a bottom block unit such that the top block unit may configure to build a furniture top outer surface, a link block unit may configure to build a furniture main body and the bottom block unit may configure to build a furniture bottom surface on a ground. Furthermore, the exemplary system may further comprise a plurality of support units that may configure to reinforce the furniture structure against a pressure on the furniture structure such that the support units may include a support strap and a connection cap. In addition, the support strap may configure to protect the furniture against a horizontal force on the furniture structure and the connection cap may configure to fasten the support strap.

The above general aspect may have one or more of the following features. In an exemplary implementation, the modular units may be made of a polystyrene material. In an exemplary implementation, the modular units may be made of an expanded polystyrene. In an exemplary implementation, the modular units may have a polyhedron geometry. In an exemplary implementation, the top block unit may comprise at least four flat side walls, a flat top surface, and a top block connection side such that the top block connection side may be embedded in a bottom surface of the top block unit and the top block connection side may include at least one Lego-type fastening groove. In an exemplary implementation, the link block unit may comprise at least four flat side walls, a first link block connection side, and a second link block connection side such that the first link block connection side may be embedded in a top surface of the link block unit and the second link block connection side may be embedded in a bottom surface of the link block unit such that the first link block connection side may include at least one Lego-type fastening protrusion and the second link block connection side may include at least one Lego-type fastening groove. In an exemplary implementation, the bottom block unit may comprise at least four flat side walls, a bottom block connection side, and a bottom surface such that the bottom block connection side may include at least one Lego-type fastening protrusion and the bottom surface may include at least one connection cap cylindrical aperture and at least one flat cap cylindrical aperture. In an exemplary implementation, the Lego-type fastening protrusion and the Lego-type fastening groove may comprise a polygonal cross section geometry and an inner hollow space that may configure to pass the support strap. In an exemplary implementation, the Lego-type fastening protrusion may extend from a modular unit's surface such that the Lego-type fastening protrusion may have an octagonal cross-section. In an exemplary implementation, the Lego-type fastening groove may comprise the octagonal cross-section and the Lego-type fastening groove may be designed with a recess within the modular unit's surface. In an exemplary implementation, the recess in the modular unit's surface may comprise an octagonal cylindrical shape. In an exemplary implementation, the octagonal cylindrical shape may comprise a first section and a second section with a different inner diameter such that an inner diameter of the first section may be larger than an inner diameter of the second section such that the fastening protrusion may enter the fastening groove from the second section.

In another general aspect, the present disclosure is directed to exemplary multifunctional modular furniture system to produce various type of a furniture. The exemplary system may comprise a plurality of modular units that may configure to build a furniture structure such that the modular units may include a top block unit that may configure to build a furniture top outer surface, a link block unit that may configure to build a furniture main body, and a bottom block unit that may configure to build a furniture bottom surface on a ground such that top block unit may include at least one fastening groove and the link block unit may include at least one fastening groove and at least one fastening protrusion and the bottom block unit may include at least one fastening protrusion. In addition, the fastening groove may comprise at least two section with an octagonal cylindrical shape with a different inner diameter such that an inner diameter of a first section may be larger than an inner diameter of a second section. Furthermore, the first section may be mounted on a top of the second section such that the fastening protrusion may enter the fastening groove from a bottom of the second section. In addition, the exemplary system may further comprise a plurality of support units that may configure to reinforce the furniture structure against a pressure on the furniture structure such that the support units may include a support strap and a connection cap such that the support strap may configure to protect the furniture against a horizontal force on the furniture structure and the connection cap may configure to fasten the support strap.

description.heading: Example
Fabrication of a Sofa Utilizing a Multifunctional Modular Furniture System
description.p: In this example, as illustrated in FIG. 12, an exemplary sofa was fabricated consistent with the teachings of exemplary embodiments of the present disclosure. In a first step, a bottom face of the exemplary sofa was built utilizing sixteen exemplary 3*3 array bottom blocks such that the bottom face of the exemplary sofa was placed on a ground and a first layer of the exemplary sofa was built. In this case, the sixteen exemplary 3*3 array bottom blocks were arranged in 4-rows, 4-columns arrangement (1202). In a second step, a second layer of the exemplary sofa was built utilizing four exemplary 2*8 array link blocks and six exemplary 2*4 array link blocks (1204). Following that, a 3th layer of the exemplary sofa was fabricated utilizing five exemplary 2*8 array link blocks and two exemplary 2*4 array link blocks (1206). Afterward, four exemplary 2*8 array link blocks and six exemplary 2*4 array link blocks similar to the 2th sofa layer (1208) was applied to construct a fourth layer of the exemplary sofa. In next step, a fifth layer of the exemplary sofa layer was built utilizing twelve exemplary 2*6 array link blocks (1210). Then, for fabrication of a sixth layer of the exemplary sofa, three exemplary 2*8 array link blocks and two exemplary 2*4 array link blocks (1212) were attached to a top of the exemplary blocks of the fifth layer to build an arm and a back of the exemplary sofa. Afterward, by utilizing four exemplary 2*6 array link blocks and two exemplary 2*4 array link blocks (1214) a 7th sofa layer was constructed. Following that, an 8th layer of the exemplary sofa was built utilizing three exemplary 2*8 array link blocks and two exemplary 2*4 array link blocks (1216). Afterward, a 9th layer of the exemplary sofa was constructed as same as the 7th layer (1218), a 10th sofa layer (1220) was built similar to the sixth layer, and a 11th layer of the exemplary sofa (1222) were built similar to the 7th layer. Following that, twenty-four exemplary connection caps were mounted within the link block units (1224) and twenty-four exemplary connection caps were mounted within the bottom block units (1226).
